sub_title: Lead | Business Model Innovation, Service Design
summary:
Taylor is an award-winning design leader, engineer, and entrepreneur with over six years of experience in innovation, service design, venture building and insights research. Currently a Lead on PVH digital fashion ventures, she designs, tests and validates new data-driven business models for Tommy Hilfiger and Calvin Klein global brands. 

She is also Editor in Chief and CEO of Reflections With, a publication and platform for female leaders and entrepreneurs. She is Founder of several start ups, including The Green Room, Regenerative Brand and Anekdote. 

Website: Taylor.Black

Areas of expertise: *Design leadership, *Facilitation, training, & teaching, *Venture building & business design, *Service & strategic design, *Visualization, drawing & illustration, *Research & experimentation, *CX (customer experience), *EX (employee experience), *Regenerative design & sustainability

Taylor is currently based in Amsterdam and mobile across Europe, the US, and Australia.

Becoming Agents of Change & Innovation, UX Australia Keynote: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D_8Q-I6QnB8

profile_positions.description:
Driving the PVH growth engine AREA 52 through the innovation funnel, building new ventures, bringing new products and services to market from 0 to 10, and creating new revenue streams. Working across Tommy Hilfiger and Calvin Klein brands.

- Digital fashion 
- Venture building and business design
- Value proposition and competitive advantage
- Identification of riskiest assumptions 
- Prototyping and experimentation for evidence-based desirability, feasibility and viability validation 
- Growth hacking, growth marketing 
- Partnerships, MVP, pilots
- Scaling
profile_positions.title: Lead Venture Builder

profile_positions.description:
In August 2022, less than 5% of Fortune Global 500 companies were run by female CEOs [Fortune]. Women and nonbinary face systemic disadvantage in the workplace, and it’s not good enough.
 
Reflections With is an advocate for women and nonbinary in business and art. We are a platform and publication for others to tell their stories, be raw about their struggles and give real advice to readers. We aim to raise awareness, representation and conversation as we break the status quo and change the statistics.
profile_positions.title: CEO & Editor in Chief

profile_positions.description:
Regenerative Brand provides a suite of services to business and organisations (B2B) seeking brand establishment, profit diversity and community engagement through unique and customised Ovata tumblers. As Regenerative Brand, we endorse a waste-conscious future whereby businesses and consumers alike benefit from regenerative practices, which both enhance their personal brand and advocate for the environment.

regenerativebrand.com
profile_positions.title: Head of Strategy and Design

company.name: Carol Sanford Change Agent Development (CAD) Deep Pacific

profile_positions.company: Carol Sanford Change Agent Development (CAD) Deep Pacific
profile_positions.description:
1 year engagement, enhancing living system thinking and applying regenerative design capability to complex challenges we currently face

The Change Agent Development Community is based on a living systems paradigm, reaching beyond sustainability. It draws on the idea that humans have a role and place in the world to become intentional about evolving ourselves and a direction for humans, life and Earth. Further, nothing and no one has reached their full potential – as a product, business, or natural resource or as a person.

Development of living-systems thinking capability and management of one’s own state of being and will can endlessly advance intentional evolution and the expression of each living system’s potential. This nature of growth is the most certain path to making a greater contribution, sourced from our individual uniqueness and essence, and to the experience of more meaning in our lives.
profile_positions.title: Regeneration Change Agent

profile_positions.description:
As EX Design & Program Lead, I focused on Hydro Tasmania's internal design strategy and building internal capability of employee experience designers. I provided strategic advice on employee experience benchmarking metrics and decision making tradeoffs, and lead multidisciplinary project teams and programs across the Hydro Group enterprise. This achieved greater cultural embedment, ROI visibility, and more effective EX service design and implementation.

Building Hydro Tasmania's EX practice from the ground up, my role was to both do the work and build the practice, capability and community of practice across teams and locations. I was responsible for partnering with key stakeholders to develop and design a regenerative employee experience strategy, operationalising delivery and measuring impact. 

Leveraging Human Centred Design (HCD) and a multi-disciplinary team, the Employee Experience Team considers the full employee lifecycle, value proposition and growth horizons across the Hydro Group Enterprise: Entura, Hydro Tasmania and Momentum.
profile_positions.title: Employee Experience Design & Program Lead

profile_positions.description:
SOCIALLY JUST, CULTURALLY RICH, ECOLOGICALLY RESTORATIVE
The International Living Future Institute’s mission is to lead the transformation toward a civilization that is socially just, culturally rich, and ecologically restorative. We are premised on the belief that providing a compelling vision for the future is a fundamental requirement for reconciling humanity’s relationship with the natural world.

As an ILFI Ambassador, I represent Living Future Challenge programs in public presentations and knowledge sharing of Living Future programs, including Living Building Challenge, Living Community Challenge, Zero Energy, Zero Carbon and Living Product Challenge design and certification. Learn more and get involved, here: https://living-future.org/
profile_positions.title: International Living Future Institute (Sustainability) Ambassador

profile_positions.description: Using Human Centred Design (HCD), we challenge traditional thinking by putting the user and customer needs at the centre of conversation and cultivating a growth mindset. Using qualitative research, quantitative research, prototyping methods and theory of change (behavioural psychology), we achieve substantially more impactful outcomes and impact.
profile_positions.title: Customer Experience (CX) Design Consultant, Transportation Sector

profile_positions.description:
Innovation Co-Lead for Victoria in the Aurecon i40 

The i40 works at the intersection between Aurecon teams and clients, acting as the conduit of embedding Design to Innovate methodologies in how we work with clients. We work with project and technical directors in bringing ideas to life through a process of exploration and experimentation that creates and delivers new value for our clients.
